page.name: Analysis of Arguments and Use of Evidence
page.intro: This rubric can be used to help students focus on what is good argumentative writing and help them revise their writing. It can also be used for peer review and for teacher evaluation of student writing.
page.content:
The 2014 GED® assessment focuses on three key elements of writing – analysis of arguments and use of evidence, development of ideas and organizational structure, and clarity and command of standard English conventions, with each element being worth up to 4 points on a 12 point scale. The analysis of arguments and use of evidence rubric highlights the expectations for the writing. This rubric can be used to help students focus on what is good argumentative writing and help them revise their writing. It can also be used for peer review and for teacher evaluation of student writing.
